channel.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
channel.description: I guess it doesn't matter what I want my own game to have, it only matters what the people want. I need to know what all of you like seeing in servers. Do you like servers where nothing is required levels to wear, servers where you get a 99 in a matter of an hour, servers that start you off max stats, servers that allow you to spawn items, etc. Tell me briefly or in detail what you like.

item.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Okay new question guys.

What do you want/like to see the second you log in for the first time? Like custom home areas, spawned portals to take you places, npcs, etc. Or do you just like the original lumbridge home area with the men and women? Like what does the home area when you log in have to have to appeal to you and make you stay? How convenient should things be, like accessing items (excluding the item prices), banking, teleporting/getting around?

Read full topic
item.source: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?

item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

I don’t find a lot of attractive servers, and it’s rare to see me on server’s that don’t have the old GameFrame. Though, I like servers with the old GameFrame and skilling, economy, and good player killing. Basically, I like the classic 317-377 player killing servers.

item.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:25, topic:376245”]Nothing that extremely overpowers another (E.G. Statius, dragon claws, etc)…if it’s balanced than I can be fine with it, but that doesn’t mean pump up the damage on everything else. Godswords are an exception for me, and I enjoy seeing them in a server.

Don’t make everything easy to get, but at the same time don’t make it impossible (putting strong monsters in the wilderness where people are bound to PK).

In other words, make it basic and creative. Minigames are great, especially if they are your own idea. Everything has an exception of course, but mainly I look at the creativity and stability of the server.[/quote]
That’s basically how your server was. You used to turn it on for a few hours and get like 10+ online in no time.

Im actually working on making an old source like pimpscape stable and host it to gauge player reactions to it.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?

item.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Nothing that extremely overpowers another (E.G. Statius, dragon claws, etc)…if it’s balanced than I can be fine with it, but that doesn’t mean pump up the damage on everything else. Godswords are an exception for me, and I enjoy seeing them in a server.

Don’t make everything easy to get, but at the same time don’t make it impossible (putting strong monsters in the wilderness where people are bound to PK).

In other words, make it basic and creative. Minigames are great, especially if they are your own idea. Everything has an exception of course, but mainly I look at the creativity and stability of the server.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?

item.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“rash, post:23, topic:376245”][quote author=kingman002 link=topic=472179.msg3454272#msg3454272 date=1293943326]

There shouldn’t even be a donator rank.

Donations are to support the server, not to pay for your benefits.

I agree…

Though hardly anybody wants to ‘donate’ if you should even call it that unless they get something in return
[/quote]

“Donator” should be renamed to “Premium Member”

Donating means you gain nothing[/quote]
thats basically what i just said…

@topic: in a server i look for: old rs graphics (317) (always): sometimes a spawn pk server but some items u needa work for, or a server where u needa train (i like skilling and combat) and money isnt too easy but item prices aren’t like 10m for a whip or 300m for bandos, and NO CUSTOM ITEMS (although custom item servers are fun every once in a while)

Read full topic

item.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=472179.msg3453054#msg3453054 date=1293887267]

EDIT: My server had stable shops with reasonable prices. I sold up to rune items into shops. You received the dragon items by killing dragons. I had somewhat challenging skills and no objects were spawned in one area. People actually had the entire world to train and you would walk to the areas and train or I would make teleports to the areas. Basically, everything made sense, unlike the things that don’t make sense like clicking on a chest for mining xp.

[/quote]Name one server where clicking on a chest = mining?[/quote]

Why? What I was getting at is that it’s actual walking around and cutting trees you see or going to a mining site and training rather than the objects being spawned for in one area.

But one server that had that shit was allstar where chest clicking gave slayer xp.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?

I had somewhat challenging skills and no objects were spawned in one area. Basically, everything made sense, unlike the things that don’t make sense like clicking on a chest for mining xp.

item.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“Sir Jay, post:11, topic:376245”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=472179.msg3453033#msg3453033 date=1293886684]
Well you guys are saying skilling and an economy but when I had my server that way no one played. They’d log in, say this server sucks, and log out.
[/quote]

You have to be committed and implement your ideas and feelings into your server, you can’t just quit because some people don’t like it. When I create my servers I do them for the sense of achievement and for my friends.[/quote]

Well I didn’t mentally quit, I physically quit. I couldn’t keep paying and afford that damn vps. After 2 months of constant and constant advertising, I still had like maybe 7 people. Bull shit. Trust me. A LOT of my ideas and feelings went into my server.

EDIT: My server had stable shops with reasonable prices. I sold up to rune items into shops. You received the dragon items by killing dragons. I had somewhat challenging skills and no objects were spawned in one area. People actually had the entire world to train and you would walk to the areas and train or I would make teleports to the areas. Basically, everything made sense, unlike the things that don’t make sense like clicking on a chest for mining xp.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?

item.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:6, topic:376245”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=472179.msg3453009#msg3453009 date=1293886073]

Nothing, I’m really not interested in them no matter how much I like them.

Umm… K… So let me write that down because it helps me so much.

You asked for opinions, I gave you one.

It’s an opinion based on how repetitive rsps are.
[/quote]

I’d figure it would be implied to give me some sort of information besides “nothing” because what can I work with from that?[/quote]

You can work on something new, there has been like 20 of these threads and everyone says the same thing. Thus relating back to my original point of repetitiveness. If you really want an answer, here it is.

Good skilling.

Now you can make it like every other server, because I just told you what I told the 20 other people.

So, yes,

Good skilling, and good, hard game play.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?

item.title: What do you look for in a server that will make you stay 100% of the time?
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Jay Sir Jay
item.description:
@Sir_Jay wrote:

runefreak10:

Well you guys are saying skilling and an economy but when I had my server that way no one played. They’d log in, say this server sucks, and log out.

You have to be committed and implement your ideas and feelings into your server, you can’t just quit because some people don’t like it. When I create my servers I do them for the sense of achievement and for my friends.

Read full topic
